intro: Chamaecrista arrojadoana, commonly known as the Brazilian burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its seeds are encased in hairy, pod-like fruits that can persist on the plant for extended periods. Chamaecrista arrojadoana is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
